trans-unit.source: List Indexes
trans-unit.target: List Indexes

trans-unit.source: List Indexes (Azure Search Service REST API)
trans-unit.target: List Indexes (Azure Search Service REST API)

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>List Indexes</languageKeyword> operation returns a list of the indexes currently in your Azure Search service.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>List Indexes</languageKeyword> operation returns a list of the indexes currently in your Azure Search service.

trans-unit.source: Request
trans-unit.target: Request

trans-unit.source: HTTPS is required for all service requests.
trans-unit.target: HTTPS is required for all service requests.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>List Indexes</languageKeyword> request can be constructed using the GET method.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>List Indexes</languageKeyword> request can be constructed using the GET method.

trans-unit.source: The <codeInline>api-version</codeInline> parameter is required.
trans-unit.target: The <codeInline>api-version</codeInline> parameter is required.

trans-unit.source: The current version is <codeInline>api-version=2015-02-28</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: The current version is <codeInline>api-version=2015-02-28</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="62ffee0b-ae3b-46c1-9ddb-a372d21c6f4d" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Versions of the Azure Search Service REST API</link> for details and alternative versions.
trans-unit.target: See <link xlink:href="62ffee0b-ae3b-46c1-9ddb-a372d21c6f4d" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Versions of the Azure Search Service REST API</link> for details and alternative versions.

trans-unit.source: Request Headers
trans-unit.target: Request Headers

trans-unit.source: The following table describes the required and optional request headers.
trans-unit.target: The following table describes the required and optional request headers.

trans-unit.source: Request Header
trans-unit.target: Request Header

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Required.
trans-unit.target: Required.

trans-unit.source: The <codeInline>api-key</codeInline> is used to authenticate the request to your Search service.
trans-unit.target: The <codeInline>api-key</codeInline> is used to authenticate the request to your Search service.

trans-unit.source: It is a string value, unique to your service URL.
trans-unit.target: It is a string value, unique to your service URL.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>List Indexes</languageKeyword> request must include an <codeInline>api-key</codeInline> set to an admin key (as opposed to a query key).
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>List Indexes</languageKeyword> request must include an <codeInline>api-key</codeInline> set to an admin key (as opposed to a query key).

trans-unit.source: You will also need the service name to construct the request URL.
trans-unit.target: You will also need the service name to construct the request URL.

trans-unit.source: You can get the service name and <codeInline>api-key</codeInline> from your service dashboard in the Azure Preview Portal.
trans-unit.target: You can get the service name and <codeInline>api-key</codeInline> from your service dashboard in the Azure Preview Portal.

trans-unit.source: See <externalLink><linkText>Create an Azure Search service in the portal</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/documentation/articles/search-create-service-portal/</linkUri></externalLink> for page navigation help.
trans-unit.target: See <externalLink><linkText>Create an Azure Search service in the portal</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/documentation/articles/search-create-service-portal/</linkUri></externalLink> for page navigation help.

trans-unit.source: Request Body
trans-unit.target: Request Body

trans-unit.source: None.
trans-unit.target: None.

trans-unit.source: Response
trans-unit.target: Response

trans-unit.source: Status Code: "200 OK" is returned for a successful response.
trans-unit.target: Status Code: "200 OK" is returned for a successful response.

trans-unit.source: Here is an example response body:
trans-unit.target: Here is an example response body:

trans-unit.source: Note that you can filter the response down to just the properties you're interested in.
trans-unit.target: Note that you can filter the response down to just the properties you're interested in.

trans-unit.target: For example, if you want only a list of index names, use the OData <codeInline>$select</codeInline> query option:

trans-unit.target: This is a useful technique to save bandwidth if you have a lot of indexes in your Search service.
